title: [CPP Graph] Fix Graph Model quantization on AVX2-only Platforms
body:
## Type of Change: bug fix

API not changed

## Description
Fixed a few problems that prevent the code compile and run on AVX2 platforms (with Windows11 in my case). Therefore, I can prepare / update quantized models on my local windows machine and saving disk space on servers~

## Expected Behavior & Potential Risk
N/A

## How has this PR been tested?
`cmake -GNinja -DNE_AVX512=OFF -DNE_AVX512_VBMI=OFF -DNE_AVX512_VNNI=OFF ..`. Commands for model conversion / quantization are the same as that in README.

## Dependency Change?
N/A

title: [CPP Graph] ChatGLM-2 Enabling
body:
## Type of Change

Feature add

## Description

New models add:
* [ChatGLM-2](https://huggingface.co/THUDM/chatglm2-6b)

TODO:
* Add extension-test
  - https://github.com/intel-innersource/frameworks.ai.lpot.lpot-validation/pull/501
  - https://inteltf-jenk.sh.intel.com/view/nlp-toolkit-validation/job/ITREX-cpp-graph-extension/75/

* The performance of the GLM2 q8_j tested is 8CORE. Thanks @violetch24 
  -  Env:  8260
  -  Conf: q8_j  / block_size 128 & 32
  -  8255c physical machine block_size=128: 80.80ms; block_size=32: 87.84ms
  -  8260 on block_size=128: 91.39ms; block_size=32: 98.42ms (As shown below)

![20a96697-bf0f-47f3-bef0-41949309d5d8](https://github.com/intel/intel-extension-for-transformers/assets/109137058/2ca7c8bf-0933-4b1d-b921-35d626d62da2)

![5ec2d235-c9be-4c8b-8b9d-d91ae39a5216](https://github.com/intel/intel-extension-for-transformers/assets/109137058/cbee2b5d-ae32-43cd-9d14-368256363b22)

* Issues(Fixed in https://github.com/intel/intel-extension-for-transformers/pull/278):    
  - [x]  Get n_ctx by ctx->model.hparams.n_ctx.
          The rope requires the size of prompts but not the fixed model.haprams.n_ctx. No need to chage.
  - [x] add parameters list bos_token_id / eos_token_id / pad_token_id / sep_token_id to voca.
          These parameters has been added to model.vocab.
  - [x] multi-query-attention(MQA) double check for ChatGLM-2.
          Use n_head_kv instead of multi_query_group_num may cause accuracy issues.

## Expected Behavior & Potential Risk

N/A.

## How has this PR been tested?

Manual and CI tests.

## Dependency Change?

N/A.

title: Any benchmarks having been made between llama.cpp and  ITREX graph?
body: According to the publication of `An Efficient Sparse Inference Software Accelerator for Transformer-based Language Models on CPUs`, it seems the major improvements of this project is to provide a faster sgemm kernel for model compression. Since ITREX graph is also an inference engine for x86 CPUs, any performance comparison has been made between it and llama.cpp ?

5. add workspace pre-allocation

GPTJ    comp_type=[int8,fp32,bf16], bits=[4,8], group_size=[-1,128], 
group_size=-1 only for int8 per channel.

title: [CPP Graph] AMX-BF16 MHA with KV update
body:
## Type of Change: Feature API changed: `--memory-f16` and `--memory-auto` added along with the old `--memory-f32` flag ## Description AMX BF16 MHA with customized KV-cache update stage to maintain the customized memory format for best performance of MHA. - The kv-update operation can be optimized if necessary; currently reference implementations are used - S8 MHA are also added for future use, the corresponding update method will be adding in future changes - BF16 MHA with transposed K-tensor add; integration work will be in a future PR - FP16MHA add; integration work will be in a future PR ## Expected Behavior & Potential Risk Note: As this PR updates jblas code, **models need to be re-quantized**. ## How has this PR been tested? Runing `run_llama` & `run_gptj` ### Model Preparation - `python scripts/convert_gptj.py --outtype f32 --outfile gpt-j-6B.bin gpt-j-6B` - `./bin/quant_gptj --model_file gpt-j-6B.bin --out_file gptj-q4j-int8-fp32-b128.bin --bits 4 --nthread 20 --alg sym --block_size 128 --scale_dtype fp32 --compute_type int8` - Similar commands for `llama_7b` ### Inference result -
GPTJ: AMX-BF16 MHA with KV update enabled - (yi) [dingyi@mlp-spr-03 build]$ ninja && numactl -m 1 -C 56-111 bin/run_gptj -m /home_local/dingyi/data/gptj-pr165-q4j-int8-fp32-b128.bin --seed 1234 -t 56 -b 512 -c 512 -n 256 -p "Once upon a time, there existed a little girl, who liked to have adventures. She wanted to go to places and meet new people, and have fun." > Once upon a time, there existed a little girl, who liked to have adventures. She wanted to go to places and meet new people, and have fun. Her mom had this really cool job at the local library, so they could afford all of these things for their girl. They also went on lots of trips together: Disneyland, SeaWorld, the Space Center, just about any city around them. The mother loved her work, and the daughter loved going places. It was a magical time in their lives, that made them both happy. > > So then mom got promoted to become a librarian in a small town in California. This meant that she had to move from Sacramento to Bakersfield - quite a drive - and they couldn't afford moving trucks, so the mother walked! They were going into this new city, and their daughter was excited - this was going to be fun! > > It turned out to be not much fun at all - the girl hated it. She didn't like her school or class mates. She didn't even like her teacher very much. And she missed her mom terribly, who was gone for weeks and weeks at a time, only coming home in between visits. Her parents were stressed about money, too, because their job moved them from Bakersfield to a bigger city, where they had to get jobs so they could afford rent and food and clothing. > > Sometimes it seemed like they were just
-
GPTJ: AMX-BF16 MHA with KV update disabled - (yi) [dingyi@mlp-spr-03 build]$ ninja && numactl -m 1 -C 56-111 bin/run_gptj -m /home_local/dingyi/data/gptj-pr165-q4j-int8-fp32-b128.bin --memory-f16 --seed 1234 -t 56 -b 512 -c 512 -n 256 -p "Once upon a time, there existed a little girl, who liked to have adventures. She wanted to go to places and meet new people, and have fun." > Once upon a time, there existed a little girl, who liked to have adventures. She wanted to go to places and meet new people, and have fun. Her friends would help her with this because they knew that she was curious about everything. > > One day while talking to her mom on the phone, she asked her "Mommy, why do people cry?" Hearing her child say so made her mother laugh a little. She told her daughter that sometimes people will have tears in their eyes or eyes filled with water because they're happy or sad. But, usually people do not go around crying all day, which is where the girl's question came from. > > "Well," she was told on the other end of the phone, "you mustn't cry for too long either. Otherwise you'll get tired." Her mother explained further that sometimes it happens because we're so happy about something that we can't stop laughing or crying and it won't stop for quite a while. > > So, her mom told her to ask some questions. She was sure she'd be able to think of a few good ones. "Can you give me an example?" was what she asked at the beginning. But, as soon as she said this, she found herself thinking about a bunch of different scenarios and trying to figure out which one would make sense for the little girl. > > Her mom's advice stuck in her mind, Note: this generation is the same as that on the main branch.
### Inference latency -
GPTJ: AMX-BF16 MHA with KV update enabled (default on SPR with GCC13) - (yi) [dingyi@mlp-spr-03 build]$ ninja && ENGINE_PROFILING=1 numactl -m 1 -C 56-111 bin/run_gptj -m /home_local/dingyi/data/gptj-pr165-q4j-int8-fp32-b128.bin --seed 1234 -t 56 -b 512 -c 512 -n 256 -p "Once upon a time, there existed a little girl, who liked to have adventures. She wanted to go to places and meet new people, and have fun." First token ``` === GRAPH Profiling === perf_total_per_op_us[ ADD] = 2.682 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ MUL] = 0.882 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ NORM] = 3.717 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ MUL_MAT] = 3.837 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ MUL_MAT_WITH_BIAS] = 1.883 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ RESHAPE] = 0.267 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ VIEW] = 0.754 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ PERMUTE] = 0.093 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ GET_ROWS] = 0.286 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ ROPE] = 2.093 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ MUL_QKV] = 12.131 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ FFN_ADD_GeLU] = 23.225 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ FLASH_ATTN] = 1.607 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ FLASH_ATTN_KV_UPDATE] = 22.759 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ INNER PRODUCT] = 0.000 ms ======================================== ``` Last token ``` === GRAPH Profiling === perf_total_per_op_us[ ADD] = 0.451 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ MUL] = 0.172 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ NORM] = 1.060 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ MUL_MAT_WITH_BIAS] = 0.609 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ RESHAPE] = 0.274 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ VIEW] = 0.751 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ PERMUTE] = 0.124 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ GET_ROWS] = 0.023 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ ROPE] = 1.570 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ MUL_QKV] = 5.120 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ FFN_ADD_GeLU] = 12.097 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ FLASH_ATTN] = 1.841 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ FLASH_ATTN_KV_UPDATE] = 1.385 ms perf_total_per_op_us[ INNER PRODUCT] = 2.709 ms ======================================== ``` Prediction latency ``` ========== eval time log of each prediction ========== prediction 0, time: 79.93ms prediction 1, time: 32.00ms prediction 2, time: 30.42ms prediction 3, time: 30.79ms prediction 4, time: 30.74ms prediction 5, time: 30.57ms prediction 6, time: 30.76ms prediction 7, time: 30.09ms prediction 8, time: 30.78ms prediction 9, time: 30.96ms ... prediction 250, time: 31.67ms prediction 251, time: 31.65ms prediction 252, time: 30.93ms prediction 253, time: 31.59ms prediction 254, time: 31.10ms prediction 255, time: 31.01ms ```
-
GPTJ: AMX-BF16 MHA with KV update disabled - (yi) [dingyi@mlp-spr-03 build]$ ninja && ENGINE_PROFILING=1 numactl -m 1 -C 56-111 bin/run_gptj -m /home_local/dingyi/data/gptj-pr165-q4j-int8-fp32-b128.bin --memory-f16 --seed 1234 -t 56 -b 512 -c 512 -n 256 -p "Once upon a time, there existed a little girl, who liked to have adventures. She wanted to go to places and meet new people, and have fun."
